fp.utils

Class PrimeTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • fp.utils.PrimeTools

  • public class PrimeTools
extends Object
    This class contain the necessary tools for testing whether some integer is prime or not.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PrimeTools()

      Method that checks whether a and b are coprime.
      long findTheSmallestR(long n)
      Finds the smallest r for which r is bigger than log_2(n).
      long gcd(long a, long b)
      Function that the greatest common divisor of a and b.
      boolean isPerfectPower(long n)
      Slower method for testing if an integer is a perfect power.

      Function that determines n^exponent modulo mod.

      Checks the multiplicative order of a modulo n.

        Sieve-based primality test.
        Parameters:
        n - Integer to be tested.
        Returns:
        Boolean that tells whether the integer n is prime or not.

      • aksPrimalityTest

        public boolean aksPrimalityTest(long n)
        AKS Primality test that is much faster than the above one.
        Parameters:
        n - Integer to be tested.
        Returns:
        Boolean that tells whether the integer n is prime or not.

      • findTheSmallestR

        public long findTheSmallestR(long n)
        Finds the smallest r for which r is bigger than log_2(n).
        Parameters:
        n - The prime relative to which r is calculated.
        Returns:
        The smallest r satisfying the requirement.

      • multiplicativeOrd

        Checks the multiplicative order of a modulo n.
        Parameters:
        n - Modulo.
        a - Integers whose multiplicative order needs to be counted.
        Returns:
        The multiplicative order of a modulo n.

      • isPerfectPower

        public boolean isPerfectPower(long n)
        Slower method for testing if an integer is a perfect power.
        Parameters:
        n - Integer to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if it is, false if it isn't.

      • gcd

        public long gcd(long a,

        Function that the greatest common divisor of a and b.
        Parameters:
        a - One integer.
        b - Another integer
        Returns:
        gcd(a, b).

      • areCoprime

        public boolean areCoprime(long a,
                          long b)
        Method that checks whether a and b are coprime. That is, whether gcd(a, b) = 1.
        Parameters:
        a - One integer.
        b - Another integer
        Returns:
        True, if gcd(a, b) = 1, otherwise false.

      • phi

        public long phi(long n)
        Euler's totient function. For given integer n, calculates phi(n), that is the number of integers that are relative prime to n.
        Parameters:
        n - The argument of phi(n) for which we want to calculate the number of integers relative prime to it.
        Returns:
        The number of integers relative prime to n.
